titleStmt.title: The Second Part of King Henry the Sixth
titleStmt.author: William Shakespeare

respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

Â© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

castItem.roleDesc: Bishop of Winchester, great-uncle to the King
Lords, Ladies, Attendants, Aldermen, Officers, 'Prentices, Falconers, Guards, etc.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: London. The palace.

Flourish of trumpets: then hautboys. Enter the KING, HUMPHREY, Duke of GLOUCESTER, SALISBURY, WARWICK, and CARDINAL BEAUFORT, on the one side; the QUEEN, SUFFOLK, YORK, SOMERSET, and BUCKINGHAM, on the other.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 2
div.stage: The DUKE of GLOUCESTER'S house.
Enter DUKE HUMPHREY and his wife ELEANOR.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 3
div.stage: The palace.
Enter three or four Petitioners, PETER, the Armourer's man, being one.

l.stage: Sound a sennet. Enter the KING, DUKE HUMPHREY of Gloucester, CARDINAL BEAUFORT, BUCKINGHAM, YORK, SOMERSET, SALISBURY, WARWICK, and the DUCHESS OF GLOUCESTER.
Exit Gloucester. The Queen drops her fan.
Gives the Duchess a box on the ear.
Enter HORNER, the Armourer, and his man PETER, guarded.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 4
div.stage: GLOUCESTER'S garden.
Enter MARGERY JORDAN, HUME, SOUTHWELL, and BOLINGBROKE.

l.stage: Here they do the ceremonies belonging, and make the circle; Bolingbroke or Southwell reads, Conjuro te, c. It thunders and lightens terribly; then the Spirit riseth.
As the Spirit speaks, Southwell writes the answer.
Enter the DUKE OF YORK and the DUKE OF BUCKINGHAM with their Guard and break in.
Exeunt above Duchess and Hume, guarded.
Exeunt guard with Jordan, Southwell, c.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: Saint Albans
Enter the KING, QUEEN, GLOUCESTER, CARDINAL, and SUFFOLK, with Falconers halloing.
Enter a Townsman of Saint Albans, crying

l.stage: Enter the Mayor of Saint Albans and his brethren, bearing SIMPCOX, between two in a chair, SIMPCOX'S Wife following.

sp.speaker: Simpcox
sp.stage: After the Beadle hath hit him once, he leaps over the stool and runs away; and they follow and cry, âA miracle!â

div.head: Act 2, Scene 2
div.stage: London. The DUKE of YORK'S garden.
Enter YORK, SALISBURY, and WARWICK.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 3
div.stage: A hall of justice.
Sound trumpets. Enter the KING, the QUEEN, GLOUCESTER, YORK, SUFFOLK, and SALISBURY; the DUCHESS OF GLOUCESTER, MARGERY, JORDAN, SOUTHWELL, HUME, and BOLINGBROKE, under guard.

l.stage: Exeunt Duchess and other prisoners, guarded.

Enter at one door, HORNER, the Armourer, and his Neighbours, drinking to him so much that he is drunk; and he enters with a drum before him and his staff with a sand-bag fastened to it; and at the other door PETER, his man, with a drum and sand-bag, and 'Prentices drinking to him.
Alarum. They fight, and Peter strikeshim down.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 4
div.stage: A street.
Enter GLOUCESTER and his Servingmen, in mourning cloaks.

l.stage: Enter the DUCHESS OF GLOUCESTER in a white sheet, and a taper burning in her hand; with SIR JOHN STANLEY, the Sheriff, and Officers.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 1
div.stage: The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
Sound a sennet. Enter the KING, the QUEEN, CARDINAL, BEAUFORT, SUFFOLK, YORK, BUCKINGHAM, SALISBURY and WARWICK to the Parliament.

l.stage: Exeunt all but Queen, Cardinal Beaufort, Suffolk, and York; Somerset remains apart.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 2
div.stage: Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
Enter certain Murderers, hastily.

l.stage: Sound trumpets. Enter the KING, the QUEEN, CARDINAL BEAUFORT. SOMERSET, with Attendants.
Noise within. Enter WARWICK, SALISBURY, and many Commons.
Re-enter WARWICK, and others, bearing GLOUCESTER'S body on a bed.
Re-enter SUFFOLK and WARWICK, with their weapons drawn.
Exeunt all but Queen and Suffolk.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 3
div.stage: A bedchamber.
Enter the KING, SALISBURY, WARWICK, to the CARDINAL in bed.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 1
div.stage: The coast of Kent. Alarum. Fight at sea. Ordnance goes off.
Enter a Captain, a Master, a Master's-Mate, WALTER WHITMORE, and others; with them SUFFOLK, and others, prisoners.

l.stage: Exeunt Whitmore and others with Suffolk.
Exeunt all but the First Gentleman.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 2
div.stage: Blackheath.
Enter GEORGE BEVIS and JOHN HOLLAND.

sp.speaker: John Holland
sp.stage: Drum. Enter CADE, DICK the Butcher, SMITH the Weaver, and a Sawyer, with infinite numbers.

sp.speaker: Jack Cade
sp.stage: Enter some, bringing forward the Clerk of Chatham.

sp.speaker: Jack Cade
sp.stage: Enter SIR HUMPHREY STAFFORD and his Brother, with drum and soldiers.

l.stage: Exeunt the two Staffords, and soldiers.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 3
div.stage: Another part of Blackheath. Alarums to the fight, wherein both the STAFFORDS are slain.
Enter CADE and the rest.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 4
div.stage: London. The palace.
Enter the KING with a supplication, and the QUEEN with Suffolk's head, the DUKE OF BUCKINGHAM and the LORD SAY.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 5
div.stage: London. The Tower.
Enter LORD SCALES upon the Tower, walking. Then enter two or three Citizens below.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 6
div.stage: London. Cannon Street.
Enter JACK CADE and the rest, and strikes his staff on London-stone.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 7
div.stage: London. Smithfield. Alarums. MATTHEW GOFFE is slain, and all the rest.
Then enter JACK CADE, with his company.

sp.speaker: Messenger
sp.stage: Enter GEORGE BEVIS, with the LORD SAY.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 8
div.stage: Southwark. Alarum and retreat.
Enter CADE and all his rabblement.

sp.speaker: Jack Cade
sp.stage: Enter BUCKINGHAM and old CLIFFORD, attended.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 9
div.stage: Kenilworth Castle. Sound trumpets.
Enter KING, QUEEN, and SOMERSET, on the terrace.

l.stage: Enter, below, multitudes, with halters about their necks.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 10
div.stage: Kent. Iden's Garden.
Enter CADE.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
Enter YORK, and his army of Irish, with drum and colours.

l.stage: Enter old CLIFFORD and his Son.
Enter the EARLS OF WARWICK and SALISBURY.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 2
div.stage: St. Alban's. Alarums to the battle.
Enter WARWICK.

l.stage: Enter RICHARD and SOMERSET to fight. SOMERSET is killed.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 3
div.stage: Fields near St. Alban's. Alarum. Retreat.
Enter YORK, RICHARD, WARWICK, and Soldiers, with drum and colours.
